CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND.relationship: The test case TC_EVCC_CMN_VTB_CmSlacParm_009 involves the CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message The Test System waits for the CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message
CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND.description: "CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND" is an indication message related to the start of attenuation characterization. It is used in the communication process.
CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND.chunk_context:
The received attenuation values within CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message are based on the physical channel.
If the NUM_SOUNDS field in a CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is zero, then the ATTEN_PROFILE has no significance and the whole messages shall be ignored. It is up to the EV to decide what number of M-SOUNDS used for the attenuation profile is sufficient for its decision (i.e. whether to discard CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND if NUM_SOUNDs is less than C_EV_match_MNBC).
The low-layer communication module on the EV side shall send its decision using the following relevant message after the CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message.

CM_MNBC_SOUND.IND.relationship: The test case TC_EVCC_CMN_VTB_CmSlacParm_009 involves the CM_MNBC_SOUND.IND message The Test System waits for the CM_MNBC_SOUND.IND message
CM_MNBC_SOUND.IND.description: "CM_MNBC_SOUND.IND" is an indication message related to MNBC sound, which is used in the communication process.
CM_MNBC_SOUND.IND.chunk_context:
Within CM_MNBC_SOUND.IND message sequence, the EV shall transmit the CM_MNBC_SOUND.IND message C_EV_match_MNBC times. With each message, the counter field 'cnt' shall be decremented.
The time duration between consecutive CM_MNBC_SOUND.IND messages shall be TP_EV_batch_msg_interval.
After sending the last message of the CM_START_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message sequence, the EV shall wait for TP_EV_batch_msg_interval before starting the CM_MNBC_SOUND.IND message sequence.

CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND.relationship: The Test System sends the CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message The CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message is sent after the TT_EV_atten_results timer expires
CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND.description: An indication message containing attenuation entries and other parameters
CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND.chunk_context:
The received attenuation values within CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message are based on the physical channel, and the ATTEN_PROFILE within the message CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND shall be calculated by arithmetic mean of the ATTEN_PROFILE of the CM_ATTEN_PROFILE.IND of previous M-SOUNDS corrected by the attenuation of the receive path AttnRx-EVSE.
If the NUM_SOUNDS field in a CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is zero, then the ATTEN_PROFILE has no significance and the whole messages shall be ignored. It is up to the EV to decide what number of M-SOUNDS used for the attenuation profile is sufficient for its decision (i.e. whether to discard CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND if NUM_SOUNDs is less than C_EV_match_MNBC).
If a CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND is received and its origin is an EVSE that has not sent a CM_SLAC_PARM.CNF before, the message shall be processed and not ignored.
F.3.2 EVCC templates for CmAttenCharInd module Templates_EVCC_CmAttenCharInd { import from DataStructure_SLAC all; template MME_Payload md_EVCC_CMN_CmAttenCharInd_001

TT_EV_ATTEN_RESULTS_TIMER.description: A timer that expires before sending the CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message

CM_ATTEN_CHAR.RSP.relationship: The test case TC_EVCC_CMN_VTB_CmSlacParm_009 involves the CM_ATTEN_CHAR.RSP message The Test System checks that no CM_ATTEN_CHAR.RSP message is sent The CM_ATTEN_CHAR.RSP message is not sent until the TT_match_response timer expires
CM_ATTEN_CHAR.RSP.description: "CM_ATTEN_CHAR.RSP" is a response message related to attenuation characterization, utilized in the communication process.
CM_ATTEN_CHAR.RSP.chunk_context:
In order to check that the received attenuation values within CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message are based on the physical channel, the MTC shall be able to reduce the level of signal on the control pilot.
According to the result of the SLAC process, the low-layer communication module on the EV side shall send its decision using the following relevant message after the CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND message.
If the EVSE has not received a CM_ATTEN_CHAR.RSP within TT_match_response, it shall retransmit a CM_ATTEN_CHAR.IND when the TT_match_response expires and reset this timer. After C_EV_match_retry attempts, if no CM_ATTEN_CHAR. RSP is received by the EVSE, the matching process shall be considered as FAILED.

Test system then checks that no CM_SLAC_MATCH.CNF message is sent by the SUT until the TT_match_response timer has expired.

GOODCASE_PROCEDURE.description: The "GOODCASE_PROCEDURE" is a specific procedure executed by the Test System to establish a new AVLN (Access Virtual Local Network) and send CM_AMP_MAP.REQ messages. Additionally, it signals CP State E and sends a CM_SLAC_MATCH.CNF message. This procedure is integral to validating communication processes within the system.
GOODCASE_PROCEDURE.chunk_context:
Test System executes GoodCase procedure with SLAC validation process.
No relevant information found.

CM_AMP_MAP.CNF.relationship: The CM_AMP_MAP.CNF message is part of the communication protocol specified by ISO:15118-3:2015:IS The SUT sends the CM_AMP_MAP.CNF message The CM_AMP_MAP.CNF message is sent in response to the CM_AMP_MAP.REQ message
CM_AMP_MAP.CNF.description: "CM_AMP_MAP.CNF" is a confirmation message sent by the System Under Test (SUT) with 'result' equals to '00'H. This message is sent in response to the CM_AMP_MAP.REQ message, indicating the result of the request.
CM_AMP_MAP.CNF.chunk_context:
The CM_AMP_MAP.CNF message is a confirmation message that indicates the result of the request sent by the CM_AMP_MAP.REQ command. It includes a result code where 0x00 indicates success, 0x01 indicates failure, and 0x02 to 0xFF are reserved.
If a low-layer communication module has sent a CM_AMP_MAP.REQ but does not receive a valid CM_AMP_MAP.CNF within the max(TT_match_response), it shall retransmit the CM_AMP_MAP.REQ.
If the requested node receives another CM_AMP_MAP.REQ, this means that the counterpart station retransmitted its request for some reason (i.e. the CM_AMP_MAP.CNF was not received); the requested node shall respond to the request again.

CM_AMP_MAP.REQ.description: "CM_AMP_MAP.REQ" is a request message used in the communication process to send a new amplitude map along with additional valid parameters. This message plays a crucial role in ensuring that the amplitude map and its associated parameters are accurately communicated within the system, facilitating effective and efficient data transmission.
CM_AMP_MAP.REQ.chunk_context:
The CM_AMP_MAP.REQ command is used to request the counterpart low-layer communication module to reduce the transmission power for certain carriers. It has different functions depending on the source/destination of the message.
If a low-layer communication module has sent a CM_AMP_MAP.REQ but does not receive a valid CM_AMP_MAP.CNF within the max(TT_match_response), it shall retransmit the CM_AMP_MAP.REQ.
If the requested node receives another CM_AMP_MAP.REQ, this means that the counterpart station retransmitted its request for some reason (i.e. the CM_AMP_MAP.CNF was not received); the requested node shall respond to the request again.

ISO:15118-3:2015:IS.description: The ISO:15118-3:2015:IS is an International Standard document that serves as a reference for the ISO 15118-3:2015 standard. This ISO standard specifies the communication protocol for electric vehicle charging, ensuring interoperability and compliance within the electric vehicle charging infrastructure.
ISO:15118-3:2015:IS.chunk_context:
This standard outlines the vehicle to grid communication interface, specifically focusing on the physical and data link layer requirements. It includes sections on amplitude map exchange and the functional description of related messages.

Road vehicles — Vehicle to grid communication interface — Part 3: Physical and data link layer requirements

It is specifically the system being tested in the V2G (Vehicle-to-Grid) communication process and is involved in the described procedures. Additionally, the SUT is responsible for sending the CM_AMP_MAP.CNF message.

D-LINK_READY.INDICATION.relationship: The D-LINK_READY.indication informs HLE about the status of the communication link
D-LINK_READY.INDICATION.description: A message indicating the status of the communication link, either 'link established' or 'no link'
D-LINK_READY.INDICATION.chunk_context:
{'description': 'The D-LINK_READY.indication shall inform higher layers about a change of communication link status. This indication shall be sent with any change in link status. The values of the D-LINK_READY status are independent of the states of the control pilot signal.', 'matching_process': "Any transition from the state 'Matching' triggers a call of the primitive D-LINK_READY.indication to indicate a successful or failed data-link setup.", 'table_info': {'entity_to_support': 'EV, EVSE', 'parameter_name': 'D-LINKSTATUS', 'description': 'Status of communication link: no link, link established.'}}
If a data link was established and a D-LINK_READY.indication(link established) was already indicated to higher layers, any detected loss of the data link shall cause a D-LINK_READY.indication(no link) indication to higher layers.
The time between the detection of other stations in the current logical network after the SLAC_MATCH exchange and the indication D-LINK_READY.indication (link established) to higher layers shall not exceed the performance timer TP_link_ready_notification.
As soon as the lower layers detect a data link after a wake-up, it shall send a D-LINK_READY.indication(link established) to HLE.
When the low-layer communication module leaves the logical network, it shall inform HLE through the D-LINK_READY.indication (no link).

HLE.description: A higher layer entity involved in the binding process
HLE.chunk_context:
As soon as the lower layers detect a data link after a wake-up, it shall send a D-LINK_READY.indication(link established) to HLE.
With receiving a D-LINK_TERMINATE.request from HLE, the communication node shall leave the logical network within TP_match_leave.

D-LINK_TERMINATE.REQUEST.relationship: The D-LINK_TERMINATE.request is sent by HLE to terminate the data link
D-LINK_TERMINATE.REQUEST.description: A message requesting lower layers to terminate the data link
D-LINK_TERMINATE.REQUEST.chunk_context:
The D-LINK_TERMINATE.request requests lower layers to terminate the data link.
With receiving a D-LINK_TERMINATE.request from HLE, the communication node shall leave the logical network within TP_match_leave. All parameters related to the current link shall be set to the default value and shall change to the status “Unmatched”.
With receiving a D-LINK_ERROR.request from HLE, the EVSE’s communication node shall stay in X2 control pilot state, leave the logical network within TP_ match_leave, and change the matching state to 'Unmatched' to be ready for a new matching process.

HLE.description: A higher layer entity involved in the binding process
HLE.chunk_context:
Entity to support: EV, EVSE.
With receiving a D-LINK_TERMINATE.request from HLE, the communication node shall leave the logical network within TP_match_leave.
With receiving a D-LINK_ERROR.request from HLE, the EVSE’s communication node shall stay in X2 control pilot state, leave the logical network within TP_ match_leave, and change the matching state to 'Unmatched' to be ready for a new matching process.

D-LINK_ERROR.REQUEST.relationship: The D-LINK_ERROR.request is sent by HLE to terminate the data link and restart the matching process
D-LINK_ERROR.REQUEST.description: A message requesting lower layers to terminate the data link and restart the matching process
D-LINK_ERROR.REQUEST.chunk_context:
The D-LINK_ERROR.request requests lower layers to terminate the data link and restart the matching process by a control pilot transition through state E.
With receiving a D-LINK_ERROR.request from HLE, the EV’s communication node shall keep the current state and leave the logical network and change the matching state to 'unmatched'.
A loss of communication after the establishment of a data link is handled by higher layers, by requesting with D-LINK_ERROR.request.

HLE.description: A higher layer entity involved in the binding process
HLE.chunk_context:
With receiving a D-LINK_ERROR.request from HLE, the EV’s communication node shall implement one of the two following options.
No relevant information found.

D-LINK_PAUSE.REQUEST.relationship: The D-LINK_PAUSE.request is sent by HLE to enter a power-saving mode
D-LINK_PAUSE.REQUEST.description: A message requesting lower layers to enter a power-saving mode while keeping the state to 'Matched'
D-LINK_PAUSE.REQUEST.chunk_context:
The D-LINK_PAUSE.request requests lower layers to enter a power saving mode. While being in this mode, the state will be kept to 'Matched'.
With receiving a D-LINK_PAUSE.request, the EVSE shall switch to control pilot state X1 and may switch the low-layer communication module into low-power mode. The logical network parameter set shall be stored for continuing the data link after the sleeping phase.
With receiving a D-LINK_PAUSE.request, the EV shall change to control pilot state Bx. Unpowering the low-layer communication module is optional. The logical network parameter set shall be stored for continuing the data link after the sleeping phase.
This entity is not mentioned in the provided candidate answers.

HLE.description: A higher layer entity involved in the binding process
HLE.chunk_context:
With receiving a D-LINK_TERMINATE.request from HLE, the communication node shall leave the logical network within TP_match_leave. All parameters related to the current link shall be set to the default value and shall change to the status 'Unmatched'.
This entity is not mentioned in the provided candidate answers.
